subject: Re: [junit] Quick trawl
msgSnippet: Regardless of whether it s built in or not, it s fairly easy to use JUnit.  Just import the files, set up the classpath, etc., and start writing tests. If you
messageBody:
Regardless of whether it's built in or not, it's
fairly easy to use JUnit. Just import the files, set
up the classpath, etc., and start writing tests.

If you need any specific help or examples, drop me an
email at:

ericheikkila@...

-Eric

--- Dave Dench <d.j.dench@...> wrote:
>
> Dear All,
> Sorry but this is a quick trawl.
> I have been given an introductory Java module to
> teach. The module
> as it runs at present uses the BlueJ environment. I
> have it in the back
> of my mind to introduce some Test-Driven
> Development. Does anyone here know
> ( or better use ) a BlueJ environment that has been
> embellished with JUnit
> support ?
> Thanks,
> David
>
>
